title: Man Utd news: Mauricio Pochettino agrees with Roy Keane on Harry Kane
text:
Harry Kane’s future has been debated in recent days (Picture: Visionhaus)

Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino ‘more than agrees’ with Roy Keane after the Irishman said Manchester United should buy Harry Kane.

Keane suggested that his former club should sign the England striker as they look to create a side that can challenge in the Premier League under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

‘Go and get [Harry] Kane,’ said the former United captain on Sky Sports. ‘Just go and get Kane from Spurs, easy. He’ll score 20 goals a season with his eyes shut. They’re in disarray, so go and get him.’

Pochettino would hate to see Kane leave north London, but was full of praise for Keane as he responded to the comments, and said that his striker ‘deserves everything.’

‘I heard what was said,’ Pochettino told a press conference. ‘Of course, I respect him and admired him when he was a player. He was the kind of player who you want beside you, or as a centre-back like me you want him in front of you.

Mauricio Pochettino made an unlikely admission about Kane (Picture: Getty Images)

‘Whenever I listen to him he is very clinical in his comments.

‘Of course he loves good players and Harry Kane is a fantastic player. We more than agree Harry Kane deserves everything.’

Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admitted that he is a big fan of Kane, but dismissed his chances of bringing in the prolific forward.

‘Roy’s quite straightforward isn’t he,’ joked Solskjaer. ‘For us it’s working hard, getting Anthony back is gonna be a massive boost for us and I’m sure when Anthony comes back that’ll help Marcus as well. With the forwards we’ve got and the pace, I’m looking forward to the next few weeks.

‘There aren’t many… Lewandowskis and Harry Kanes, they’re like Shearer, Van Nistelrooy, fantastic players. Ours are diff types of players but I like someone who can finish half a chance and he does that. Harry’s one of the best but he’s a Tottenham player.’

Former Arsenal star Paul Merson agrees with Keane that the Red Devils should get the cheque book out because Kane is a safe investment.

‘Manchester United need to go and break the bank because they need a goalscorer,’ Merson told Sky Sports. ‘For me, he’s one of the best around and he’s proven.

‘They need someone to come in and hit the ground running with 25 goals next season. ‘He’d be moving to the biggest club in the world. Even if they spent £120m, you know you’re buying goals and you wouldn’t be sweating. ‘He’ll get you 25 goals a season without you sweating.’
